Reviews.Title: “Central location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: apso0206
Reviews.Content: Hotel Daphne is centrally located in Sultanahmet in Istanbul. All the key attractions - the Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Restaurants etc are a short walk away. The trams are close by as well. The hotel premises are small, but the rooms are fairly large (bathrooms decent size) and can comfortably provide for a couple with two large suitcases. There is no self-catering coffee and tea facility in the rooms, but the hotel management has no issues in your making coffee and taking it up to your room in the morning. Breakfast is limited, functional. If you have time, don't miss dinner on the terrace restaurant which has stunning view at night. Overall, we had a great stay and would happily recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “A Gal from Toronto in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: 24Karats
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 205 at this hotel from April 5- April 8 /2012. I did a stop over from spending a couple of weeks touring India. This hotel is a boutique hotel. It has approximately 20 rooms and very very personable. They speak English and are very helpful with tours and pre-paid airport shuttle service back to the airport (only 15 TLs). The hotel room has all what you need and it looks like what you see on the hotel.com websites etc. I found the location very ideal and best for a tourist. All the great must see places are waking distance or a short Trem ride. The breakfast was god they served most Europeans which is very understandable. However, food plenty to get you ready for all the walks. I found the bed great to sleep. The bathroom was very clean and cared for. The shower doors did have a challenge for they did not closed exactly tight and therefore I would leak water most times. The heater levels were a tad loud so keep it so very low and you will not have an issue. The TV needed some instructions at the start. However there are TV English channels but you have to search for them, many many channels to watch them. The hotel location is easy to return from your shopping spree since the hotel is so close to the happening places and of course the eateries too. Ask the front desk clerk for the hotel shuttle back which is a heck of alot cheaper than the taxis upon arrival at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, good service, clean”
Reviews.Author: seema60
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in April. The reception was very attentive when we arrived late at night. The room was spacious and clean. The room safe didn't work..we were in 403. They were happy to organize tea in the morning as they had no self service in the room. The bathroom was standard size and had all the amenities. The biggest advantage is the location..in the heart of Sultanahmet, close to all the historic places like Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque and the Topkapi museum. The Grand Bazaar is 7 minutes away. You can see the sea from Room 502. Close to restaurants and shops. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Alyn682
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this lovely boutique hotel for 3 nights on 17 - 20 March 2012 (Room 304) and came back for 1 more night on 27th March (Room 203) before living for Brunei which was arrange by Magnificent Travel, Turkey. Both rooms are excellent and clean at all time. could not be more satisfied with the service, with homey atmosphere and friendly staffs (the room service, bar staff and reception manager). the staffs here are not just friendly but very accommodating whenever needed. Breakfast was great with varieties of options. Location is the best where all in walking distances in the heart of Sultan Ahmed square the hippodrome, blue mosque, grand bazaar. we would love to recommend this hotel to future customers. Loves from Aiman, Alinah and Little Alya

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Kelli W
Reviews.Content: Could not be more pleased with this boutique hotel. Located in a very charming area of the old city-near blue mosque, bazaar and key historical sites. This hotel was a major upgrade from the dirty and loud hostel in taksim square were I originality booked. Found this hotel in my lonely planet guide. Staff is very professional and nice/helpful. Room was very clean and beds super comfy and a great shower. Also the breakfast buffet is a good spread! Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, excellent service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: cosmopolitan-NL
Reviews.Content: During the four days I stayed in this lovely boutique hotel, I enjoyed it tremendously. The staff is just great, service minded and professional. Best of all is the breakfast buffet, which offers a large array of international items and turkish dishes. The rooms are conveninient and well equiped with sundry items, slippers and nice towels, TV, minibar and aexcellent wifi internet connection. What a great value. I needed help on checking in for my return flight and they immediately set me up with the laptop in the lounge/lobby bar, served me a complementary coffee and printed my boarding passes instantly after sending it to the hotel e-mail address. Just great! By the way ask for the reservation manager manager directly and you will get an excellent deal. I walked in staying at another place and moved to Daphne Hotel the same day. Don't forget to ask for a room on the sea side with a spectecular view of the bay of Mararis. I enjoyed the roof terras restaurant as well at night and tried some of the beautiful Turkish wines they have on the list. Great fun with a great view!! I can recommend this hotel if you look for value and a great experience. I stayed for leasure, but I suppose it is excellent for the business traveler as well. They offer 3 - 4 star service and accomodation, for an excellent price. The family owners are frequently around and that makes one feel welcome and at home. Thank you! I will go back to Daphne hotel again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Just sit on the terrace and watch the view..”
Reviews.Author: CanadaThomas_R
Reviews.Content: It is really first class boutique hotel,you can find quality room and quality sleepin in here.The hotel has wonderful seaview,you feel your self like a living out of world like a heaven,just sit on the terrace and listen good music , you will feel so good And hotel from 2 minutes by walking to the hippodrome So if you want to be inside area and at the same time if you want to have good quite sleep you have to stay hotel daphne.clean and pretty hotel, i

Reviews.Title: “Cozy room for couple”
Reviews.Author: Kaffah
Reviews.Content: The hotel close to blue mosque and grand bazaar. If you are couple, go there. It is worth it out of the money you will spend. Friendly staff and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel,wonderful seaview”
Reviews.Author: Murat O
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my friends for christmas .it was our best holiday,hotel daphne has very nice coustumers and very nice ,swetty rooms.Hotel has so romantic view at terrace restAurant.And customers so helpful .The rooms are Pretty and cleaning is most important for hotel also for us,daphne hotel has 5 Stars experiences but it has boutique concept .people who is going istanbul,they should stay at Daphne hotel.

Reviews.Title: “memnuniyetim”
Reviews.Author: Jemal F
Reviews.Content: I slept in one of the most beautiful hotels in the Hotel Daphne.Rooms, lobby and terrace with spectacular seaview.The customers are very helpful and hotel is very clean and has mystical design mix with ottoman and modern.It is the first time i came Istanbul and i stayed at Hotel Daphne .The Hotel has a really positive energy.You can feel your self so special like a king :) .Certainl i suggest people Hotel Daphne , if you need really feel relax and happy, Stay here. The most beautiful gift to yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Still as good as I remember from 2008”
Reviews.Author: loafin
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very comfortable, even if small. We were happy to stay here because the location is excellent and the staff is helpful at every need. The breakfast is a mix of Turkish and European; light but well sufficient. I suggest they add fresh fruit though there was plenty (for me) of dried fruit. All-in all, I will continue to stay here whenever I can. The view of the Maramara Sea from 501 was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “you have to seen this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bianka B
Reviews.Content: It's a very consuming hotel.While you are staying there , you feel like a special person maybe like a prince or princess.Our 12.wedding year , we stayed at Hotel Daphne.They are so kindly customers,they organized wine and ver delicious pancakes for us.Hotel Daphne has differential about it's place.Because of , you can go the sultanahmet area 2 minutes by walking,here is so crowded but if you need quite place you can stay at hotel or you can sit at Hotel Daphne'S terrace which has challenging view.Maybe i can't explain the seaview enough,you have to go and you have to stay there.While you are staying there , you feel purified everything.When i came my home,i feel renewed myself.That's most important thing for me and my husband.Thank you Hotel Daphne customer for everything , We hope we will come again at spring.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: GlobalguyOttawa
Reviews.Content: There are many hotels of this type-familiy owned, boutique feel, located in Sultanhamet but this one disappints for several reasons. Location is not bad just two or three blocks back of the Blue Mosque and half way between the Aya Sofia and the Grand Bazzar. The lobby restaurant/breakfast area is small and has no real redeeming features. The upstairs terrace offers great views of the Bosphorus but was not open for breakfast during my visit. It was available for dinner if you ask nicely.. This was low season for sure but I was also disapointed in the quality of the food for dinner and the price is about 30% more expensive as items on their menu are displayed in Euros when all other restaurants display it in Liras. My main complaint was the paper thin walls !! Ugh. Even with the TV at moderate level I could hear the couple next door go at it and all their conversations felt like they were actually in my room. The room is small but most are in this part of IST. Bed was OK comfortable. Bathroom was OK. So location is probaby its best feature and price was good and fair. I just think you can do better. When I arrived my room had a non fuctional TV and a lamp that did not work. Wifi was free in the room though. Hotel Uyan for example was a gem last time I visited and probably a better value.

Reviews.Title: “great location...so-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love2TravelDoU
Reviews.Content: As far as the hotel's location, you can't beat it, but the hotel itself was only so-so. It's perfectly located near the Blue Mosque and lots of shops and restaurants in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul. But this area is full of hotels, so you can definitely shop around. You could tell that Daphne Hotel had been in the area for a while, but they are actually in the process of completing a renovation project. All new wood, cabinetry, and bathroom fixings...one area they've forgotten are the beds. They are not comfy! The breakfast was continental and had plenty of options. Lots of cheese, meats, fruit, breads, drinks and more. When we checked in, room 401 had yet to receive a new tub...it was quite unattractive (mold). Plus we had a smoking neighbor and their smoke was seeping underneath our door...though Europe is trying to embrace the 'non-smoking' in public places like hotels, this is quite hard to enforce in a society that loves to smoke. They had a monetary fine for smoking in the rooms, but I doubt they use it. As a result of the mold and smoking, we asked for another room. We moved one floor down to 301 and it was ok. The view from that side of the building is beautiful. Definitely request room 301, 401 (once completely renovated) or 501. They each have a view of the Marmara Sea. There are always ships at sea and the sunsets are very nice. The staff is very helpful also. They also offered free transfer between the hotel and the airport (roundtrip). This was a nice perk. Like I said the location canâ€™t be beat. My husband and I walked to the Blue Mosque in about 5 minutes or less. Tons of restaurants/cafes, the Grand Bazaar and Egyptian Bazaar are all in walking distance from Daphne.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: DKatchalov
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in October. Hotel is well located away from the main tourist area but close enough to walk to them. Some rooms have great views over the Sea of Marmara. Service is ok, rooms sligtly dark, bathroom had mould in it. Cleaning of the room was average, could frequently smell smoke even though our room was non-smoking. Breakfast was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Daphne, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: inay1026
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in walking distance to Blue Mosque,Ayasofya Museum, Topikapt Palace and Grand Bazaar. It is in great location too, You can easily go anywhere using public transportation. The Hotel staff was very helpful in making arrangements for daily excursions and even last minute arrangements for an English guided tour. They offer a shuttle to take guests to and from airport too. I strongly recommend to stay in this hotel when you visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul Experience”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne P
Reviews.Content: Having visited the hotel on a previous trip we were impressed and decided to try it ourselves and found it very enjoyable. The staff was great and we had a lovely room with balcony overlooking the Sea of Marmara. Although the dinner on the rooftop isn't the best we have had, the fabulous view is the reason for having drinks and/or eating there. The bathroom was spacious and well appointed and the breakfast was very good. The location is terrific for sightseers.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Daphne - B&B in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Mooneyson1
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms were European type small but adequate. TV was marginal and we could not get wi-fi in our room 501, but in the breakfast/lobby area. Room was clean and maintained. Contrary to the ad, the "bar" is marginal in a tucked way place as part of the lobby. Breakfast was very good and well stocked. We were there for two nights before a cruise and one night following. The best part is the dining area on the roof which, although expensive, has a marvelous view and is very quiet. The hotel is difficult for taxi drivers to find (even with the business card) but is very close to all of the history. The neighborhood is very quiet. I believe there are 5 rooms per floor and five floors +/-.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay at Hotel Daphne”
Reviews.Author: trip-4-2-td
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visted Istanbul and stayed at Hotel Daphne for 4 nights. It is a boutique style hotel with great staff and great breakfast. Our room was beautifully decorated and we had a view of the sea of Marmara. Do ask for a room with a view of the sea at no extra charge. The staff was very helpful and answered all the questions that we had. The breakfast staff was also very good, he was so nice and alway brought more food whenever he saw that the trays were empty. This hotel is pretty close to all the major sites such as Hagia Sophia, The Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, etc.It is kinda hard to find, tucked away in an alley but we just asked the locals. From the airport, we took the metro, then tram, and walked maybe 10-15 minutes. Thank you for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great position, great view”
Reviews.Author: OzTravelerNewYork
Reviews.Content: We were picked up from the airport(automatic with this hotel if staying 3+ days). We had a spacious room with a nice view of the Marmar sea and an old mosque. The hotel is in a brilliant position with easy walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Hagia Sofia, Museums, Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazaar, Tram service and local Laundromat. Rooms were well insulated for sound and had excellent ACs.(We stayed 4 days and then returned for another 3 days). The staff were very helpful and went out of their way to assist with organizing taxis, tour contacts, maps and instructions.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel , wonderful holiday in Istanbul !”
Reviews.Author: Eynil Kenny P
Reviews.Content: A clean hotel with great location and staff.At Daphne Hotel's staffes are all of them helpful, they helped us about best city tours and also it was cheap .They explained us every place in Istanbul about tours, historical places and good foods.The rooms decoration is so quality and very clean place.Delisious and healthy breakfast menu consists of a highly,and the best thing is hotel's terrace view's , it sees all of Istanbul and seaviews are so romantic,With a relaxing atmosphere .That was the real and best holiday for me and we will visit Daphne again with my famil,Thank you Hotel Daphne and the helpfl staff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, top location and very comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: K A
Reviews.Content: Due to our wedding party which we organized in Istanbul, we had guests coming from abroad. By referral and first inspection we chose the Daphne Hotel and booked various rooms : single and double rooms, as well as one for a family with a baby, in total 9 rooms. Feedback we got from our friends were :"Excellent", "top location", "very nice and comfortable rooms", "very kind and helpful personal", "beautiful view from the terrace", "unique boutique hotel" and "felt like being at home". Any wishes from our side were always considered to make our friends feel very confortable. Based on our friends feedback (as we wanted to have them placed well) having chosen the Daphne Hotel for our friends accommodation was the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: GulayErener
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to Istanbul several times (always staying in the Sultanahmet area) and would rate Daphne Hotel as the best I have stayed in. The hotel is located within minutes walk to all major sights and transport. All rooms have been very nicely furnished and it should be noted the showers have excellent pressure. The rooms are spacious, immaculate and comfortable. Thereâ€™s a cosy and tasteful modernity an individuality that makes you feel like staying in a home. The buffet breakfast is lavish and healthy, They will help you arrange sightseeing tours, Airport transportation, etc. and also will provide you with terrific dinner recommendations. A laptop computer in lobby offers free internet to all guests which is very handy. What makes Daphne Hotel truly special is the warmth and friendliness of the staff and the very high level of service. Above all I would like to thank all the staff who took care of us very welcoming, very helpful and they go out of there way to ensure that the hotel guests have a good stay. Overall I would highly recommend the Daphne Hotel to all travellers, trust me you will not regret :))

Reviews.Title: “A quaint little hotel in Sultanahmet away from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: NazimFarhan
Reviews.Content: I was confused about which hotel to stay in Istanbul. I knew it was going to be in Sultanahmet but which one. There are literally thousands. Having read a friends review on TripAdvisor I chose this one. I was a little hesitant. We arrived at Daphne much earlier than check-in time (7 am). They were really helpful. Offered us complimentary breakfast though we were not entitled to it that day and place to sit down till current guests vacated the room. And by 8:30 we were in our room. Through out the trip the staff were really helpful and never said no to anything. Particularly Mali at reception helped finding almost anything we needed. Including my wife developed an eye problem so he helped get us to an eye hospital. Rooms were very comfortable. Our one even had a small balcony (try staying in rooms 501 or 502) overlooking the Sea of Marmar. And the hotel was on small not busy road. Opposite side of lot of the Sultanahmet hotels. Away from the hustle bustle touristy side. But still Blue Mosque was a 4 minute walk. Grand Bazaar 10 minutes. I am so glad we stayed at this area as opposed to tourist central. On the negative side, if I HAD to pick a negative, were the food prices I thought were on the higher side. (We had only one meal other than the complimentary breakfast) Over all I will wholeheartedly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, views and rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Billmorton27
Reviews.Content: The staff could not be nicer and more helpful. The air conditioned rooms are large, clean and comfortable. We had a beautiful view of the Sea of Mamara from our room and the view from the restaurant on the sixth floor is even more magnificent. the location is also perfect as you can walk to many of the tourist sites and to the commuter rail system. We stayed here based on a recommendation we received and we are very glad we did.

Reviews.Title: “amazing view to the sea very clean rooms & very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: cptmazen
Reviews.Content: starting from the reception very welcoming staff and generus manager i can not forget my excelent expierience in daphne hotel after suffering for couple of days in istanbul staying in other hotels daphne hotel has a big rooms and each room has diffrent style and also very clean and i will never forget the amazing view they have and thats reasonable beacause there is no building between the hotel and the sea side the roof or terrace has a very nice resturant great chef in the kitchen . its simple i loved it because the owners is there all the day and they take care of every thing that i need its not like the other hotels i stayed in this people make you come back again ,

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel for a good family stay”
Reviews.Author: Thakurs
Reviews.Content: To start with the staff at the hotel are amazingly courteous and friemdly compared to the other hotels within the same area. The room are cozy and comfortable and the colors are very positive. The room, the service and the bathroom for me was top notch for the price we are paying. All the major tourist spots Aya sophie , the Blue Mosque are just 5 to 10 mins walking distance and the seafront is right behind the hotel. everything with regards to Hotel Daphne is actually "5 Star" and most other hotels need to learn something from these guys, firstly good manners and a friendly nature.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: drfresa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small and off the beaten path but very near all of the important sites especially in the older part of Istanbul (walking distance or short tram ride of the Blue Mosque, Haggia Sofia, Topkapi, ferries along the Bosphorus, the Spice Bazaar and the Grand Bazaar). It is clean; rooms are lovely though small; but most importantly, the staff is outstanding!! Some rooms have a view of the Sea of Marmara and the hotel has a roof top dining area that has a lovely view. We arrived early and they were very accommodating. They will secure your luggage; clean your room as soon as possible; offer you their breakfast and/or coffee/tea; call a taxi for you, etc. We would definitely choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing boutique hotel in the heart of Sultanhamet!”
Reviews.Author: MemTrav
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful about our stay at this hotel. We were supposed to have stayed at the Lady Diana Hotel (where we unfortunately stayed upon our return to Istanbul - see my review of that property) but were moved here because rooms weren't available there. Although we moved with trepidation, it became the best thing that happened to us! The staff were incredible! So friendly, they really went the extra mile for us. Moving us to adjoining rooms which were really wonderfully big, with sea view! Really made us have a 2 room suite-style set up. They made reservations for us, called taxis, went out to the taxis with us and gave explicit directions to the drivers to ensure we got to where we were going. Really, they exceeded our expectations! The breakfast was fine, though not as extensive as a few others we encountered during our stay in Turkey. Overall, I highly recommend this property! Bravo, Daphne!

Reviews.Title: “FantastiC”
Reviews.Author: Tarananki
Reviews.Content: A lovely little boutique hotel with friendly ,courteous stass, convenient to central Istanbul. Nice clean, modern rooms, with good bathroom facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Gem - safe, clean, perfect location, good value, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: kimestry2
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend Hotel Daphne, perfect location, easy walking distance to Blue Mosque, Haiga Sofia, Grand Bazaar, Ferry, and spectacular dining. The terrance in the evening is gorgeous and may be my favorite place in all of Istanbul with beautiful views of the sea and lights on the Blue Mosque. The staff is polite, speak perfect English, and attentive, hotel is clean and safe. Love this place, cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful with view on Sea of Marmara”
Reviews.Author: RachelSchoneveld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for the first week of May. The hotel was situated walking distance from most of the important historic sites in Istanbul. The room was fantastic and was cleaned impeccably every afternoon while we were in town sight seeing. The hotel had us picked us and brought with their shuttle from and to Ataturk Airport. The shuttle was very reliable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They helped us anywhere they could. They organized a cruise on the Bosporus for us with our own private guide. Every morning we had a wonderful Turkish breakfast and many evenings we ate at the restaurant hotel on the roof. The hotel restaurant was a highlight. Not only was the food great but the view over the sea of Marmara was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Daisychain18
Reviews.Content: Super room with a view on the top floor. Good restaurant on the roof with good view. Good choice at Breakfast and very helpful staff. A short walk from the main sightseeing area. We visited at a quiet and very wet time of year but very much enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, highly recommended, efficient service, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Whybrowwendy
Reviews.Content: You couldn't find a better location for a stay in Turkey... a few minutes' walk in one direction and you're at the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, shops, restaurants and the tram stops, and in the other direction the stunning Grand Bazaar. As for the Daphne itself, there's a stunning view from the roof terrace, so don't miss a chance to wander up there. On arrival for a 10-day stay we were offered a room with a better view of the Bosphorus in a day or two, but we were so happy with our spotlessly clean room on the first floor that we didn't bother. Breakfast (included) was lavish, with fresh bread, cheeses, meats, eggs, yoghurt, juice and hot drinks. We complained that the hairdryer wasn't working, and a bulb had blown in the bathroom, and both matters were dealt with quickly and efficiently. An iron and board were provided on request and there was a laptop for guests' use ... though it took me a week to work out how to use Turkish keyboard!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: gitakrishnan01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose to stay at Daphne Hotel after glowing reviews about this small hotel and we were thrilled with our two-day stay. Ideally located, spotlessly clean and about the warmest staff you can find anywhere in the world. Our first day in Turkey was spent at the Daphne and after a four day tour of other areas, we came back to Istanbul to stay one more day at the hotel. It was like coming home. The personal touch provided especially by the Reception staff was wonderful and we wholeheartedly recommend it to any visitor to Istanbul. The icing on the cake is that it is so reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: CeciliaGisele
Reviews.Content: I would like to recommend Daphne Hotel! It was travelling alone, and it was a perfect place to be. Location is close to all the most attractions in Sultanhamed. People at the hotel were very nice and 100% customer oriented. Staff always willing to assist! I would recommend this hotel, and of course, if I come back to Istambul I will be at the Daphne Hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel, perfect location, excellent service,”
Reviews.Author: kinga_11
Reviews.Content: Hotel Daphne is a very good, charming hotel with excellent service. Best location in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and quality hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rebecca1969
Reviews.Content: The most spectacular otel.personel stayed very well and I am very comfortable The hotel has exact location and very clean .The decoration very exicted and come too in love with a magnificent view of sea and sultanahmet place.Location is the top place.We will come with my family and friends.We loved Daphne.Very nice and quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: ashsem
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week and loved it. Great location on a quiet street but still very close to public transport, restaurants, corner markets, and many many historic sights. Very modern facilities and an incredible breakfast every morning. The staff is so friendly and very helpful. We fully intend to return someday!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, very friendly hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: oldwolfie
Reviews.Content: The Daphne Hotel is an excellent small, friendly, clean hotel. The location is excellent far enough away from the centre to get away from the noise of everything so as to get a good nights sleep but close enough to walk to all the main sights. The rooms are very clean, warm and we had hot water at all times of the day. The staff are very polite and helpful. Breakfast is of a good quality with a very good selection. Breakfast finishes at 10am but staff do not rush you out, they only clear away once you have said that you do not want anything else. There is a small restaurant across the road which offers good food at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Simply brilliant for Families - service still the very best”
Reviews.Author: Simsim69
Reviews.Content: This was our first vacation with our son who is 9 months and we Researched many hotels to stay at while visiting Istanbul, and am so glad that we found and booked the Daphne hotel. The hotel is close to some great Istanbul attractions especially the Grand Bazaar ,Blue Mosque, Suleymaniya mosque and many great restaurants close by at Sultanahmet area. Service in the hotel was great, from the front desk (Mr.Okan) and Ms.Zeynep ( who was the best and helpful person i've ever met in my life , to the housekeeping and the breakfast room was excellent. We had a lovely quite room with its sea view. Would highly recommend this hotel. thanks to all the staff at Daphne Hotel for making our stay so memorable, and can't wait to return. If you want, beautiful scenery, fabulous rooms and something different to do each day, stay here. Absolutely awesome,and will be more than happy to answer any questions :) Sameh Selim Procurement Head

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Riccardok
Reviews.Content: We were in Daphne hotel 5 days last january and was for sure one of the highlights of our trip. The hotel is located so close to the blue Mosque , less than 2 minutes walking to there, but at the same time in a lateral street so quiet during the day and the night. The view from the terrace is amazing , the room was more than expected but most of all the staff, from the owner to the other guys were excellent, so friendly and in some way i can say they took care of us; we had the impression to be at home even if so far away from there. They helped us a lot with our trip and next time we ll be in istanbul, no doubt about the fact we ll go back to Daphne. Room was great, breakfast was like a lunch, environment perfect. Thanks a lot to Miss Zeynep and to all the others. We ll come back. Hope to see you really soon, greetings from Italy. Ciao and see ya soon. =) Riccardo and Paola

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, quality and those who want to live together in a historic choice Daphne Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Michael27boy
Reviews.Content: Daphne hotels to stay in a hotel in a very different very clean and high quality.Staff, food and a unique view of the required occurrence.Us were very interested, they always help.We went there as a family of 12 persons.Hotel very liked, a place very suitable for big families.We chose the right hotel.I felt this comfortable and luxurious in the history of ourselves, but at a later date :))..Thank you Daphne Team ; Us History Week had a very special thanks to you a comfortable and high quality.

Reviews.Title: “I did not want to leave this hotel, I think, enchanted us =)”
Reviews.Author: EleanorPatrick
Reviews.Content: Istanbul to celebrate Christmas to chose the right decision and chose this hotel by reading reviews here with my best friends..The Hotel Daphne in anywhere near the area, this hotel has a very nice street, in front there is a historical artifact and the seaview.The hotel is very clean and staff very helpful,swetty. They were very interested to us. All my friends who see my photos,They've reserved for Stay At Hotel Daphne for summer.We will be already here in this hotel at Summer, it just did not want to leave this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Worth The Stay and Very Pleasant Staffs”
Reviews.Author: Premilamohanan
Reviews.Content: My husband, I and our two teenage boys stayed there for 6 nights about a week ago. We took the connecting rooms and it was very useful indeed. The rooms looked larger because of the connecting rooms and they were extremely clean and well equipped. The rooms had very good sea view and excellent wi-fi services. Bathrooms were fairly spacious and clean as well. Breakfast was simple but good variety. All the staffs especially, Mr. Okan, Mali, Oncu and Ms. Zeynep, they were all extremely nice and helpful people, always at your service. The location of the hotel is very ideal and central to most of the tourist sites at Sultanahmet. They were all located like about less than 10 minutes walk from the hotel. In conclusion, our stay at Daphne was very pleasant, it was like home away from home, affordable and memorable. It was definitely worth the stay and I would go back to this hotel again if I were to visit Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel with a great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Richrichardman
Reviews.Content: One of the cleanest hotels that Ä± see as one continuous trip, Daphne.Us the meaning of staying in boutique hotel has lived.This is truly enjoyed and had fun we had.The hotel staff felt like our house.You're close to everywhere in the center and a hotel with sea views and charms people.Daphne Hotel wrapped up in choosing the right decision .Daphne for this fabulous resort hotel and not leave us alone,no elements are very thank you.Again as soon as possible to discuss .Daphne Hotel again , we will choose as a group of 12 person's.

Reviews.Title: “Daphne is great hotel , great team my holiday was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: zeyzey
Reviews.Content: Above all an exquisite landscape and very clean rooms.Breakfast is very kind.The staff are very helpful and relevant .Indeed , the most beautiful holiday spending .I will come to stay again in a few months.Already excited for now.Thanks for everythin Daphne.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: rik786
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, staff was very helpful especially Ali, who works the afternoon shift. Nice clean room, very spacious.. Ideal location, just minutes from the blue mosque, haghia sophia and topkapi palace...

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Daniel_alloallo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the daphne hotel for 4 nights whilst visiting Istanbul. We had a room with a fantastic view onto mosques and the Bosphorus. The room was clean and spaceous, TV, minibar, jacuzzi, small terrace, Breakfast has lots of choice, freshly baked bread, fruits, cheeses etc.. the staff is helpful and friendly. This hotel is idealy situated for visiting the old town, short walking distance from Ste Sophia, the blue Mosque, the Bazaar, spice market etc... and all the restaurants too. We also sampled the restaurant on the top terrace, as we didn't want to venture further on the first evening. Good choice of turquish as well as european dishes.

Reviews.Title: “I use to travel to istanbul. And i use to...”
Reviews.Author: Riyadgabr
Reviews.Content: I use to travel to istanbul. And i use to stay at daphne hotel. Its a great hotel. Its very clean. Coasy. Warm. The location is great. The stuff are very friendly. The rooms are very nice. Thank you daphne hotel from cairo. Egypt. Riyad gabr

Reviews.Title: “Great ambience, fantastic service.â€�”
Reviews.Author: YagmurTas
Reviews.Content: Hotel Daphne is located in the heart of Sultanamhet, a few minutes from major attractions. Hotel Daphne for me means an absolute gem. We stayed at this wonderful hotel for 4 weeks, July 2010 and it could not have been more perfect!!! The location was ideal - literally a 2 minute walk to the Hippodrome, a 5 - 7 minute walk to both Sultanahmet or even Camberlitas tram stops, and all the historical sights pretty much at walking distance. The hotel is well-kept and well-managed - and one really cannot ask for more. I loved the hotel, what made the difference was the helpfulness of the staff would like to express my gratitude to Hayretin Cicek (manager) his staff who was always willing to walk the extra mile to help us out! They made a difference in comfort and satisfaction, every single one of them. I am definitely planning to stay at Hotel Daphne during my next visit to Istanbul and highly recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: Rena_Ananiades
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Daphne for four nights with our two young ones of 9 and 12 years in two lovely comfortable and luxurious connecting rooms which transformed them into a lovely spacious family suite. I feel obliged to recommend this hotel to people travelling with their families as it is located in a wonderful, picturesque neighbourhood, extremely close to Sultan Ahmed square with all the magnificent monuments, to public transport and shopping points. The hotel has a very cozy atmosphere in all it's areas and a breathtaking view over the old neighbourhood of Sultan Ahmed and the Bosphorus. An evening stroll in the narrow stone paved streets of the area is a "must" while you are there. During our stay we had the sense of being "at home" and that because of the homy atmosphere of the hotel and the friendliness of the staff who were all extremely helpful and kind to us and our kids. A special thanks here to Mehmet Ali Kiral and Ali Ihsan Balcik for all their useful tips and the warmth of their welcoming smile. Thank you guys... we won't forget you! So If you are the type of traveller who likes staying in the heart of things but without the city noise, who loves getting the essense of a place and who values good contact with people, I am sure you will love Daphne!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Feras_Hilmi
Reviews.Content: I have travelled with my family (wife, 1 child, 2 babies and nanny) and stayed at this cozy hotel for 5 nights and I have to really recommend it to all families travelling with their children, hence I have taken the 2 connecting rooms which are quite comfortable. The hotel reception, restaurant staff, managers as well as the owner were very helpful and friendly. They made me feel like home away from home. The location is very attractive and roof view of the Sultanahmet area was amazing. It only took us 2 minutes walking to reach the Sultanahmet square, shopping points and metro.

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money, but hard to find!”
Reviews.Author: vitting
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at Hotel Daphne in Sultanahmet, Istanbul. The hotel is very close to the Blue Mosque, the grand bazar and Bosporus etc. Unfortunately it was extremely hard to find and we generally spent an hour in the cab driving around the neighbourhood every time we were going back to the hotel from a meeting. The rooms were charming, lovely and clean. The bed was very good and bathroom excellent. As part of the charm he hotel is based next to a mosque so be prepared for morning prayer very early in the morning (4.45am...) Staff was lovely too, but I wouldnt recommend the roof top restaurant. I had dinner there all by myself (no other guests) and despite a big menu, they could only offer 1 kebab, no dessert and 1 red wine to choose between. Apparently this was due to the chef being on holiday (in July in the middle of the tourist season??). The sun set while I was eating and I ended up sitting in total darkness as the waiter had forgotten to turn the lights on and was nowhere to be seen... So if you are looking for a place to sleep, but not eat, this is very good value for money:) Remember to bring a map...

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem that makes your stay in Istanbul even more magical ....”
Reviews.Author: passiontravelsbyela
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the ambiance of the Daphne Hotel which is in a perfect location right in the Old City, with beautiful rooms overlooking the Sea or Marmara (most rooms) with exceptional service makes the Daphne Hotel a wonderful find in Istanbul. I've stayed at this hotel a number of times since they opened back in 2003/4 (?). I almost don't want to share this gem with others. Istanbul is magical...so is the Daphne.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, terrific views”
Reviews.Author: jdoc1
Reviews.Content: Like a previous post we had the deluxe room overlooking the sea. The location is great, just a short walk to the Hippodrome and Blue Mosque, not far from the tram stop at Sultanahmet. We were in Istanbul for a conference my husband attended but also for a few days of leisure, a total of one week. We used public transportation most of the time only using a taxi to get to the Dulmabache Palace for a fancy dinner (we heard several horror stories about taxi driver scams so avoided this method of transportation). Public transportation to the Taksim square area is about a 30 minute commute and quite crowded most of the time. The staff at the hotel were always very helpful and friendly. In fact, they made our stay very pleasant by greeting us each time they saw us, offering suggestions, giving directions, helping us with our room safe, etc. We tried to eat at the balcony restaurant one evening (late) and were quite disappointed (truly our only disappointment the entire week). Another party was eating but there was no staff in sight so we seated ourselves. We're not sure, the waiter may have misinterpreted and thought we were just there to enjoy the view but after no service for more than 15 min we called the desk to ask for a waiter to serve us. He never did appear and we left and went to enjoy a snack at a neighboring restaurant where we were very well taken care of. I did have the opportunity to eat in the restaurant (it was raining) on my last night and did enjoy my meal and received fine service. The breakfast is as described in other posts, a buffet style of a variety of cold cuts, breads, cereal, eggs, cheese, dried fruit, tomatoes, cucumbers, yogurt. Tasty but not remarkable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: zmanderson
Reviews.Content: We arrived into Istanbul in the early hours of the morning (after a flight delay & being stuck in immigration) and the hotel driver waited for us for over an hour at the airport, which was great service. The location of the hotel is perfect, you are literally around the corner from all the main sights and it is on a fairly quite street. There is a great view of the sea from the rooftop bar, the only shame is that they don't serve breakfast up there. Instead you eat on the ground floor in a rather drab looking room. The hotel is a little dated, but its clean, spacious and comfortable. We found the service of the front desk a little disappointing. When we asked for the location of one of the restaurants that they had displayed out the front they guy had no idea on the place. Most of the time the person on the front desk was talking on the phone and didn't even smile when you came past. Despite this it is a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel - luxury and good value!”
Reviews.Author: Ian_S_10
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the last minute, literally on the day we needed to stay, and from the start of that phone call until we left we felt that we were lucky to have found it (recommended on the excellent Turkey Travel Planner website). Our room was large and very comfortable with a lovely bathroom, easily rivaling the best hotel chains. Breakfast was also very good. The location is superb - we could walk to Sultanahmet in about two minutes (it's literally two roads over). For exploring the area, the tram is also within a very short, easy walk. If you want to be in the heart of the main tourist attractions (Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and the Eminonu ferry port for striking out further), we would not hesitate in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL FOR A WEEKEND AT THE BOSPORUS”
Reviews.Author: Karatschoph
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the center of sultanahmed, the ancient part of istanbul. Its next door to all the important sights of this great and modern upcoming city. Clean, modern, friendly and quiet with a wonderfull terrasse right above the marmara sea. We do come back soon!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “convenient location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: slp3360
Reviews.Content: The location is close to the Blue Mosque, the staff are pleasant and helpful, the rooms are fine by European standards. (some overseas hotels are tiny by American standards but this one had plenty of room for two people with a small divan and desk in addition to our beds.) Neighborhood is safe and quiet; I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: chinosch
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the reviews written here, and we were not disappointed. Great location, value for money, nice stuff, nice food, great roof terrace for late afternoon drink watching the sunset. It is located just 5 minutes walk to most important sites(Blue Mosque, St Sophia, Grand Bazaar, Hippodrome Obelisk and Topkapi Palace). We recommend it 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful staff, great location, comfy and restful.”
Reviews.Author: DeeDee077
Reviews.Content: Found Daphne on TA, chose it for the location and we were not disappointed, as everything in Sultanahmet is easily walkable. We were graciously met at the airport at a late hour, and the kind manager didn't charge us for pickup even though we were there only two nights. Breakfast was adequate and offered until 10, which suited us perfectly. Great views from the rooftop (and from our deluxe room) of the sea and surrounding mosques. Didn't try hotel restaurant but there are so many in the area to choose from. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “peacefully”
Reviews.Author: vidimosu
Reviews.Content: I was there in january this year and all I can say about this is awesome!!!! If you are looking for a piece of heaven you can find it here. I recommend this hotel to everybody who wants to spent few days in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Seadeta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel twice, and will do so again when visiting Istanbul. Our last stay was in August 2009. The hotel proved to be a great choice - near to all the sights in Sultanahmet, yet quiet; rooms nicely decorated and spacious - our view was magical; wireless connection working perfectly; breakfast choices tasty; the whole hotel is very clean. As we traveled by car, parking was very important, which the hotel provided and included in the price. The staff is helpful and well informed - we owe many thanks to Mr. Behnam and his advice. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!!!”
Reviews.Author: dlor321
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean and friendly- staffed ,hotel close to shopping and cultural sights, I highly recommend Daphne. The Hagai Sofia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, ferry and train stations, and shopping areas are all within walking distance. The rooms and eating areas are clean. I especially like the view of the water from the terrace. Access to wifi available. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Azmar68
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The location is convenient within walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi, Hippodrome. The staff made sure every comfort was available for me and made me feel at home. The staff went out of their way to suggest places to visit and I used a computer in the Manager's office. I would like to express my gratitude to Okan, Ali and the rest of the crew (Awesome work). They know how to make customers. The room was spacious, quite, excellent view, nicely decorated and designed. The breakfast was exceptional. I'm looking forward to go back and stay at this hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to visit Istanbul. Two thumbs up Daphne. It is an outstanding hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Old Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: Texastential
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights in this hotel during our trip to Turkey, some at the beginning, some at the end. The positives are: great location, 10 minutes easy walk to the main tourist street, Divan Yolu, less to the Blue Mosque; helpful, if occasionally shabby looking staff; clean, comfortable rooms. The drawbacks: paper thin walls, if you're next to rowdy partiers or newlyweds...you get the idea, breakfast was adequate, but I never saw anyone dine at night in the overpriced restaurant, but that's okay as there are many choices nearby. Overall this is an excellent choice as a midrange boutique hotel near the tourist areas of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay.”
Reviews.Author: dyonysios
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel while walking around in Sultanahmet. Its on a quiet little street with tons of atmosphere, has breathtaking views of the sea and is about 5 minutes from Sultanahmet square with its tram station, the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, cisterns, various monuments and a host of little tourist-trap eateries. For the overwhelmed there is also a McDonalds and a Starbucks across the street from each other and 2 minutes from the tram station. And if you're relieved to hear that, shame on you! :) Interestingly, 5 minutes walk from the hotel in the opposite direction will take you to a totally Turkish neighbourhood with tiny twisty cobbled streets, little coffee shops and bakeries and fruit sellers and so forth. Just a word of warning: Sultanahmet is very hilly! If you have difficulty walking be prepared to take it slow. Trip Advisor's star rating shows this as a 4 star. That is patently not the case. I've written a separate comment in Forums about TA's rating system because I think it leads to disappointment and consequent ruined holidays and bad reviews. Daphne is a GOOD 2 - 3 star. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The decor is clean if slightly baroque/opulent so it might feel like your grandma's formal sitting room but that's the style in Turkey, echoing past glory and days of empire as it were. Don't be put -off, its in no way overpowering but just be prepared for lots of facsimile damask fabrics and fake crystal beads hanging off everything. The doors open with an electronic card which must then be slotted in to a holder to get the electricity to work. You can't actually lock or bolt the door from the inside but staff respect the Do Not Disturb if you hang it out. Just once the cleaning crew knocked to ask but that was around noon and they wondered if we'd forgotten to take off the sign. We asked if they could come later and they agreed immediately with a smile. From that point on we were not disturbed again. The bathrooms are spacious enough and everything works fine. Standard free toiletries provided along with disposable slippers and shoe-shine paper. The cleaning staff are slightly perfunctory. They come in and tidy and make your bed but I'm not certain that they actually scrub anything on a daily basis. Certainly our towels were only changed once in 6 days. Didn't bother us but might irk some. On the same topic, you read lots of reviews (in Istanbul hotels) of theft from the rooms. We had stuff all over; cash, laptops, cameras etc etc. Not a thing missing. They have a gorgeous rooftop terrace where they serve lunch and dinner and drinks in the evening. It has a wide open unobstructed view of the sea and if you look back over your shoulder you'll see the minars of the blue mosque a few hundred meters away. By the way, watching the sun set from this terrace is an experience not to miss. They also have a lobby level restaurant where they serve the free buffet breakfast and other meals a la carte. The breakfast buffet is generous and good quality. Standard Turkish fare of breads, cheeses, olives, fresh and dried fruit and pastries along with a variety of cereals, teas and coffee. The a la carte menu looked a bit expensive. In any case, we were never in at meal times so didn't get to try. We also didn't try room service. There was a menu from the restaurant placed on the writing table in the room; I don't actually know if it was purely for the restaurant or whether they can serve in your room if asked. There's a laptop in the lobby for hotel guests to use and wifi throughout. Its not superfast but hey its free! We found we could get on to another unsecured network that had better signal strength in our room and we mostly used that. By the way, we all know not to reveal credit card or personal information on public wifi networks right? Just a friendly Public Service Announcement! I'd just add that to a large extent your hotel experience can depend on your fellow guests. We didn't see any large charter tour groups or anything like that while we were here. Groups of 3 or four grown up friends, a small gang of highly adventurous (and entertaining) American retirees, couples, a family or two with teenage kids. So the atmosphere was very nice. The only negative is that though we had a non-smoking room, smoke would filter in at night from some person or persons smoking either in the stairwell and corridors or in another room. We never did find out which. The night receptionist explained that there are smoking and non-smoking rooms on each floor and it could be from that. Easy solution would be to segregate smoking and non-smoking floors but I'm sure they'll figure it out eventually. And the other caveat, though not really a negative, is that hotels in Turkey generally have poor sound insulation. Its endemic so there's no point in complaining about this one. You'll hear the water from your neighbour's bathroom, you'll hear people in the corridors and so on. But the Daphne's location is very quiet and in general we were very relaxed and peaceful. Of course you hear the call to prayer at dawn but that's part of the deal in Sultanahmet and it would be silly to act surprised. A special shout out for Okam at the front desk. A thoroughly charming, multi-lingual man who treats you like a guest in his home. It was a working holiday for me and as my partner is 6 months pregnant it was to be our last trip away before the baby. On a day when I had to be away I asked Okam to arrange for some flowers to be sent up to her while I was at work and he did a great job!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Lauglin
Reviews.Content: Great location for many of the key tourist sites, which are in easy walking distance. Very friendly and helpful staff speaks English. Rooms clean, and ours had a great view. Hotel restaurant very nice, and many other restaurants nearby. Picked it for obvious reasons. Daphne USA

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel, friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Vicky-Chris
Reviews.Content: Our room was very spacious and comfortable with a great view out over the sea. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and arranged a transfer to to Sabina Gokcen airport at a very reasonable price. Breakfast was good and varied with a wide selection of pastries, cakes as well as cereal, eggs, olives, fruit, honey, cheese, meats etc. The location of the hotel is perfect..... in a quiet street , very close to the Hippodrome and only a few minutes to the tram stop. We loved Istanbul ... it's so lively and Hotel Daphne was a haven of quiet and allowed us to re-charge our batteries for the next day's sightseeing. I can recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with great service and a perfect location for a ourist in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: CCCChicago
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this charming and yet elegant hotel close to all the tourist atractions. One of our party was handicapped and needed a wheelchair sometimes. There was elevator at the hotel and it was close enough to the highlighs of the city that she could walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, etc. The rooms, although small, were very elegantly appointed and they set up an extra bed so we had 3 in a room. The roof top has dining or just seating in comfortable seats to enjoy the view of the city and the sea.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel with superb views in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: CanterburyBeckett
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife for a few days last week. Staff were very friendly and helpful, including organising an airport transfer for our return. The room was clean and comfortable with a fantastic view over the Bosphorus. Nice breakfast and great location, particularly if you are interested in exploring Sultanahmet. 5 min walk from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, the Cistern and the entrance to Topkapi. Also a short tram ride down to Eminonu for boat trip up the Bosphorus or wonderful food in one of the many restaurants that line the Galata bridge! Great place to relax if you are planning a mini-break.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: hassal
Reviews.Content: Great experience & good well coming at the time of arrival. Good service & friendly staff that is beside its location which is a walking distance to most of the historical places in sultanahment. They have helped us in explaining about directions & recommending many good places to visit.

Reviews.Title: “great location,great hospetality,great terrac,highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: msaadi
Reviews.Content: compared to other hotel in the same area, daphne is v good hotel in all standards, its walking distance close to all historical attraction except dolmapasha palace, employee were great, general cleanness is v good, breakfast is ok could be better. no arabic channels on tv.

Reviews.Title: “Something's Fishy”
Reviews.Author: bostonvoyager75
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Daphne Hotel at 11pm after a long day of travel, only to be informed that the person who had stayed in 'our room' previously had decided to stay an extra night, therefore there was no room available for us. They took us to an awful smoky smelling apartment the next block over for one night and promised us their best room in order to make up for the inconvenience. The next morning, we sought out the manager and he offered us a free meal on the roof deck that night to further compensate for the inconvenience. There were a lot of traditional Turkish dishes advertised on sign boards outside the hotel and on the regular hotel menu; we didn't get to choose any of them. We were served the cheapest food possible - chicken legs, potatoes, cabbage salad. All was well-prepared, but we'd already had our taste buds set for other specific menu items. They served rice pudding for dessert. My husband liked it; I can't even force myself to swallow rice pudding no matter where it's served (something about the texture turns me off), so i asked for something else and was served a piece of chocolate cake that had obviously been frozen for a very, very long time; the texture was really dry and grainy, the frosting was frozen yet melt-y at the same time and the cake tasted of freezer burn. We were very disappointed w/ the fact that they didn't truly intend to 'make it right' by allowing us to choose what we wanted to eat. The room we got was certainly not a suite as promised by the manager, but it wasn't awful either; it was what we expected to get when we booked at the hotel initially - a basic double room. We did have a tiny balcony (w/ no place to sit) from which we had a partial sea view. The worst part is that a day later, 2 couples came to check in while we were at breakfast (breakfast was always in lobby, not on roof as advertised on their web site, even though the weather couldn't have been more perfect). We could easily overhear the check in process from where we were sitting and they were each told that the people occupying their rooms had gotten sick and couldn't leave until the next day. They put the 2 couples in nearby accommodations as well, telling them they would receive the best rooms in the hotel and a free dinner on the roof terrace. What's the likelihood of 3 different guests taking ill/deciding to stay extra w/in the space of 2 days? And how does everyone get the best room in the house? This, of course, made us wonder if this was some sort of scam whereby they overbook the hotel, put people in other (less desirable) places they own for a night or two, then offer 'the best room' and a free (but cheap) meal that they choose for you and still collect the room rate for all nights (double) booked. Weird. All that said, the place is clean and decent. The breakfast is typical of what one expects to get while on the continent (they serve filter coffee - no Nescafe!). However, there was only one server/bellman/bus boy working. He was supposed to bus tables, replenish the breakfast buffet, coffee, juice, water, etc and also take care of running people's bags to the other properties when their rooms weren't available. There were times we didn't even bother asking for more coffee or whatever. We felt pretty bad for the poor guy. Our dinner service was very slow for the same reason (server running up and down from roof to kitchen and multitasking), but it was fine for us since we wanted a leisurely dinner. The car service to and from the airport was punctual and the drivers polite and professional. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to my friends; I think one could find a better place in the area for the same cost.

Reviews.Title: “You can feel like you are at home! wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: aManWhoIsInLove
Reviews.Content: I stayed about 6 days and it was perfect..the location is good..it located on city center.. and the most important thing is their service..people who are working there-they are really good educated..they know a few languages and that makes me feel like I am at home..they have a roof...and you can view everywhere you want..the food was so delicious..I will be there next time..

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: JimSteele
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying here (last summer as well), was here this time for six days. Very cozy, charming boutique hotel. Since the hotel is pretty new, all the rooms, bathrooms, and overall facilities are really in top condition and not worn. I have stayed in several highly rated hotels in the Sultanahmet area (all more expensive), and my best experience was here. Many of the hotels in this area boast of great terrace (rooftop) views, usually of the Blue Mosque. But a lot of the pictures you see advertised on their sites or from travelers' photos, are zoomed shots. The actual view usually includes unsightly run-down neighboring building rooftops, with the mosque at a distance. The view from the terrace here is of the sea. It is really, really nice. Highly recommended for couples, as the view is really romantic, especially at sunset and at night. Since this is a very small boutique hotel, the terrace (rooftop) is usually empty late at night, which is nice for couples who would like to share some private time enjoying a great sea view. =D Complimentary breakfast downstairs every morning is solid. Assortment of meat cuts, breads, pastries, fruit, coffee, etc. You can sit next to the big open window, where you can enjoy a few passerbys walking along the small cobblestone road while you eat. Staff is very helpful at front desk, all speak English. They were all helpful in explaining how to get to desired locations, the best way to get there, the approximate cost of the taxi to that location. Great location of the hotel, only 2-3 minute walk to Hippodrome/Blue Mosque/Haggia Sophia, 3-5 minute walk to the main tram station. So it is very central, but at the same time on a very quiet small street, away from the heavily congested main streets of the area. Ask for a sea-view room when making the reservation, but personally, I would still stay here even without the sea-view room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful roof terrace! And great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Arkitekt25
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel in a great part of sultanamet. The hotel is situated in the more quiet parts yet close to everything you want to see. Great value for money and a fantastic view from the roof terrace. The staff are very welcoming and friendly and also very professional.

Reviews.Title: “We were delighted with our stay in September 2008!”
Reviews.Author: katemn
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with our stay in September 2008! We found our room and bath newly/nicely redecorated .. we had a GORGEOUS sea view! (#401 and the one right next to it have especially lovely sea views .. request them if they are possibly available!) It is so clean and tidy .. we were very happy with the housekeeping .. AND I am quite picky! I am a VERY light sleeper (what a handicap!) and I slept like a baby it was so nice and quiet ..I was SO happy to have this nice quiet feature in a hotel! In fact we were so happy with the hotel that after this September stay we decided to book a second stay upon our return to Istanbul in October 2009 .. when we enjoyed it just as much as the first stay! We found it very helpful to arrange our airport transportation directly with the hotel .. it was very convenient! We also felt their room rates were excellent for the area. The hotel is within walking distance of all the main attractions; The Hippodrome, the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar, Aya Sofya, Basilica Cistern, the Turkish Museum of Calligraphy and Islamic Arts, the Topkapi palace, the tram and various places to eat. The Director/Manager, Hayrettin Cicek, is just phenomenal .. he could not have been nicer nor more accommodating! Upon departing I forgot a special mattress pad that I use for my back problems. I emailed Mr. Cickek with the address to our next hotel .. sure enough .. he forward the pad to us .. at NO expense to us .. now is that service?! I feel very comfortable in telling you that you will be very pleased with this hotel .. very convenient location .. excellent rooms, accommodating staff .. good prices .. you'll be happy! p.s. I must tell you that upon arriving home .. I SO missed the call to prayer sounds .. it was such a lovely part of Turkey .. as I write this review a second time (my first one was incorrectly rated) it makes me miss Turkey yet again .. such a wonderful country!

Reviews.Title: “Definetly better than some other places in Sultanahmet.”
Reviews.Author: deereyes
Reviews.Content: We came to Daphne after staying at another hotel. The staff at the Daphne are very nice and friendly, speak English well and are helpful. The hotel itself is clean overall. It's in a good location in Sultanahmet and, from the roof, you can see the Bosphorous. The breakfast isn't anything to write home about. It's the usual breakfast presented in Sultanahmet (cheeses, fruits, eggs and bread). hat we were uncomfortable with is that perishable food is left outside for long hours without proper handling. It's easy to see why two of our family members came down with severe diarea after having breakfast at the hotel. They also should really cover the food if they're going to keep the windows open during the summer. Otherwise flies and bees are a common site on the food. (this is actually quite common in Istanbul, it's not specific to this hotel). The room itself was of a good size and everything was nice and clean. We took two connecting rooms. The bathroom in our kid's room was great without any problems. Our bathroom was fine for the first two days but the last two days it smelled of sewage! Since we had already moved from another place (primarily because it's bathroom smelled of sewage) we realized that this may be a problem in all of Istanbul (or Sultanahmet area at least). My advice--- take air freshener with you! Overall I would say it was a pleasant stay. Oh, and don't count on their wake up call service. We asked them to wake us up so we could make our flight but they never did! Luckily, we had set our alarm on our cell phone. They did however have our driver ready to take us to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: 30Louise42
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Daphne is a Jewel in the Crown of Istanbul. The location makes it ideal to explore the major sites in Sulthanahmet. Our first floor corner room had an amazing view of the ships at anchor waiting for pilotage up the Bosphorus to the Black Sea. It was a magical scene at night. The roof top bar and restaurant is a wonderful place to unwind at sunset and chat with other travellers. Our room was very spacious with a king size bed, well appointed bathroom and a chaise lounge where we could soak up the view. There is very little street noise and we opened the double glazed windows at night. The staff are very courteous and helpful and told us how to take the tram from Sultanahmet to the Kabatas ferry terminal. The efficient airport transfer was greatly appreciated. Joanne, Perth, Australia 2009

Reviews.Title: “A very warm and cozy hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: zenNepal
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Instabul. Hotel Daphne was very responsive and accomodation over the internet. We immediately liked the feel of the hotel and felt very comfortable there. We had two older family members with us and also our young daughter and both were very happy at the hotel. The hotel staff were very warm and were always very cheerful. The rooms were clean and modest in size. All in all we were very satisfied with the hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Istanbul for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Roman1
Reviews.Content: Last week we stayed in Daphne hotel. We were booked to standard room. Upon arrival we checked the other suite room and preferred to stay in the standard room, because in the suite we looked was the moldy smell in the bathroom. Note there are No balconies in the standard rooms. The room is light, spacoius enough with conditioner. Breakfast is sufficient with fresh fruits. Teh hotel is just a minute walk from the Hippodrome area. One thing you should note: all prices in the hotel are in euros! Beer- 4euro at the top terrace. Bon voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel but not for light sleepers...”
Reviews.Author: dawn1968
Reviews.Content: We have just enjoyed a great weekend in Istanbul staying at the Daphne Hotel. The hotel is very near to the main attractions in the old city and also close to the tram line for the easy exploration of places further away. The room was modern and comfortable, reception staff were very helpful, and a good choice of food and drink was provided for breakfast. The hotel also had a nice roof terrace bar/restaurant, overlooking the sea. The only slight drawback for light sleepers is the fact that the hotel is very near a mosque, which has an enthusiastic call to prayer in the early morning, that is hard to ignore! Mind you, visiting Istanbul is all about seeing great places and soaking up the culture, so one shouldn't complain...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: pisaster57
Reviews.Content: I stayed several days in the Daphne in Istanbul. The staff were very generous with their time and advice, friendly to a fault. The Daphne is very close to many sites that are a "must see". I highly recommend the Daphne.

Reviews.Title: “so smart so carino!”
Reviews.Author: mariadvisor
Reviews.Content: I spent a beautiful journey in this hotel with my boy. We are a young couple and all was ok and comfortable. Rooms were very clean and bright. Personal is polite and kind. This hotel is very near to haya sofia and other important place. Half an hour by the airport! I adored food , specially sweat biscuits!! Booked the sea view rooms

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Facilities with homey hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Sorena8
Reviews.Content: Before choosing Daphne Hotel Iâ€™d searched a lot, checked all other hotels in Istanbul, read all written comments about them to find a good hotel in the historical part of the city. Iâ€™m completely satisfied with my decision! Daphne Hotel has been located in the historical part of Istanbul, Sultan Ahmet. This touristic area is so crowded but fortunately this Hotel has been located in very lovely calm alley facing to sea, so you donâ€™t have the problem of other hotels such as train, cars and people noises. (the only problem is mosque march which is absolutely unavoidable in Sultanahmet) The service, cleanness and organization of this hotel is perfect. In my opinion the manager and all stuffs are really professional in their job so I can conclude in one statement: you can have Luxury Facilities with homey hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: iJit
Reviews.Content: Daphane was an online 'pick in the dark' and we were happy to find the room clean and comfortable. Being by the water, the location was restful, quiet and within walking distance to all the sights. But what was most outstanding was the helpfulness and efficiency of the staff who were warm and very welcoming. As we travel frequently, these qualities are indeed a rarity, regardless of star rankings. We would highly recommend Daphane. Through a lead from Daphane, we bought a tour from Turkey Travel Center. Mr Enver Beyazuz customised a package and all his arrangements happened promptly and we throughly enjoyed the room upgrades and hotels he picked for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Hard-to-beat location”
Reviews.Author: Ahimenem
Reviews.Content: Hotel Daphne is locationally unbeatable as it is close enough to the Sultanahmet area without being right there. Topkapi Palace, Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque and the Sultanahmet Tram station are but a few minutes walk away. The fittings and decor are very modern, almost opulent at times in choice of color and fabric. The rooms are small but so very beautiful that one would not complain for lack of space. Do choose a room with a sea-view. It'll be worth every penny spent. The bathroom too is very modern. The breakfast buffet is a fairly decent spread. It's good to have a hotel which offers a pick-up; complimentary if you stay for a minimum of three nights.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Topcat1969
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Istanbul & a two night stay in hotel Daphne. The hotel was in a convenient location - minutes from Blue Mosque & easy walking distance to other old city sights. We had nice twin rooms (202 & 302) which had great views and both were lovely & clean. The hotel is in a very quiet side street away from the hustle and traffic. The staff were very good & the breakfast was fine. Overall, we had a fabulous weekend & we all loved Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Meredith52
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Istanbul, Turkey with my sister and Fiance for 2 weeks. I was on a tour and they set me up with this hotel the first night I arrived. The three of us loved it, both the morning and evening staff were so helpful. We trusted them and felt so comfortable that when we left Istanbul for 3 days (as part of our tour) we left a bag here instead of lugging it around. Both our rooms were a good size, always clean, breakfast was good, and like I said the staff was great. At the end of our tour and after being in many different hotels we chose to come back to the Daphne for the last four nights. Our train wasn't leaving until 5pm and they let us stay until 2:30pm rather than rushing us out at 10am. (the normal check out time) I am traveling Europe for 6 months and I would come back and highly recommend it to anyone who is coming to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons but overall...”
Reviews.Author: cdnabroad
Reviews.Content: My husband and parents stayed here in November 2007. I was very disappointed with our "sea view" room - you had to press your face up against the window and only then could you barely see what looked to be water! It was a small room. My parents had a bigger room with a better view, although we paid the same price. The shower was one of those "half showers" with the glass wall, so you had to squish yourself up to one end to shower so the whole bathroom didn't get soaked. The sink and shower were both clogging up. On the "pro" side - i found breakfast to be a decent spread - loved the fresh baguettes. Good location also - close to the Blue Mosque. Overall, the cons outweighed the pros and therefore I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Missed Opportunity”
Reviews.Author: Itsaboutservice
Reviews.Content: A newer construction in the old style, but showing some maintenance problems; leaky shower plumbing, moldy smell in bath, broken showerhead, broken curtain hardware, etc. Wireless worked, but spotty; only in the corner of the room. Rooms are nicely furnished, location is excellent (3 mins from Hippodrome and Blue Mosque), but the staff is at best indifferent. This is "off season"--59 euros single-- (I and one other couple only in the hotel as far as I could tell), but desk staff showed more interest in lounge TV than in being helpful. No maps, no advice. I did eat (alone) in the restaurant on the night of my arrival and had a very good meal for 12 euros. Breakfast buffet OK but not great, and apparently a staff freebie as well. There are other options in the neighborhood which could only be more guest focused; when a friend called to leave a message she was told they didn't take messages because guests kept their keys and didn't stop at the desk! With attentive staff this could be a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul Treasure”
Reviews.Author: dmw40
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a vacation in Greece and Turkey. While in Istanbul, we stayed at the Hotel Daphne. It is a small boutique hotel with reasonable prices (99 euroes a night).
