The hotel is located in the area of Sultanahmet, in the old city. It is literally two minutes from the hippodrome and the Blue Mosque. The rooms are individually decorated and each one we stayed in was charming (our visit was divided into two segments due to a visit to Cappadoccia). Each room was immaculate. The staff is very helpful and friendly. We hope to visit Istanbul again and will definitely return to the Hotel Daphne.

Reviews.Title: “istambul experience”
Reviews.Author: amnoone
Reviews.Content: my husband and i just spent 3 nights at the daphne hotel. it was well located, friendly staff, very clean, good breakfast. we would return to the daphne for our next visit to istambul. we had a great view from our room and the view of the bosphorus was even better from the rooftop. we took our coffee and breakfast to the roof every morning. Istambul was great, we always felt very safe and there are so many wonerful sights to see. It's one of very favorite cities.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: mantonandkylie
Reviews.Content: Our room in the Daphne Hotel was stunning. Beautifully decorated, very clean and very comfortable. The bathroom was great too. The man at reception was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is a five minute walk away from the Blue Mosque and Ayasofia - so a great location. The hotel as a whole however, was very noisy. From the first floor we could hear the noise and phone from the lobby and we could also hear our next door neighbours. There is also a mosque directly across the road, along with several others in close vacinity, and so the call to prayer at 6am is very loud - but you should expect that anywhere in Istanbul - just bring earplugs if you want to sleep through it. Unfortunately, we had two taxi drivers tell us they couldn't take us to the hotel because they didn't know where it was, and the man who finally agreed to take us got lost and took two hours to get us there on a drive that should have taken 20 minutes. So make sure you take a map of how to get there with you. I'd suggest that if you book this hotel, try to get a room on the top few floors and remember to bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great locaion and views”
Reviews.Author: Mayall
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely two night stay at the Daphne at the end of our holidays in Turkey. The location of the hotel is a short walk from the Hippodrome and Blue Mosque and sitting on the roof terrace is wonderul and peaceful. Room 401 was great with beautiful views and lovely decor. The staff here are very helpful and friendly and I would definitley recommend a stay here while in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Staying at Daphne Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linha
Reviews.Content: The Daphne Hotel is in a great location for tourist area, pretty near to the blue Mosque, Aya Sophia and the Hipodrome. The staff is very helpful and kind although not all of them speaks english and they are always trying to make your staying pleasant. The hotel rooms are tiny, but very very clean. The air condition works very well and the food is also very good at the hotel. I would definately recommend this hotel,and stay here again next time in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay At Best”
Reviews.Author: alesquire
Reviews.Content: Hotel Daphne is well situated and clean...but beyond that very average....Most of the hotels in the Sultanahmet area have rooftop restaurants where breakfast is served (this is my 3rd time to Istanbul) - while the Daphne does have a rooftop area, it requires you to carry your food from the lobby (at breakfast) into the the elevator and then up a flight of stairs. Also the breakfast is not particularly appealing and not much is offered. The desk staff tries to be helpful, but is either lacking in their knowledge or in language skills. All is all, the hotel is just very average and that may be a kind assessment.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Action!”
Reviews.Author: jchin1
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend traveled to Istanbul for the first time and stayed at Daphne hotel. The first night we arrived pretty late, so we had no idea where things were so didn't venture out. The next day when we went out, we realized how close Daphne was to the main area. You can walk across Istanbul in 20 minutes no matter where you stay at least, but Daphne was by the Hippodrome/Blue Mosque/Haghia Sophia, so everything was still convenient. The room was pretty nice, had a funny smell at first, but I think it's from the mothballs that they use as room deodorizers. I threw them out, but you really only notice it for the first 5 minutes each time you go into your room. Rooftop deck was nice, but only used it once, no bartender up there, so we couldn't buy a drink to enjoy the view. Breakfast left something to be desired and ended up eating bread, butter and strawberry jam for 5-6 days straight. The rest of the food didn't appeal to me (boiled eggs, cheese, etc.). Also it's important to note that there's a building being worked on right across the street so for the last 2 days we were there, we constantly had jackhammers going on in the morning and sometimes into late evening. Might want to consider researching/calling to see if that's still going on before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: s_khan74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Daphne for 7 nights on our very first visit to Turkey. We are a family of 4 and we booked connecting rooms so that we could keep an eye on the kids and were very pleased with our rooms as they were exactly what we wanted. The location is perfect for sightseeing in the Sultanahmet area and the rooms are nicely furnished, although they maybe considered slightly on the small side in comparison to rooms in English hotels. We stayed in rooms 303 and 304 and our room (303) had a nice view of the Bosphorus. The bathrooms were nice and clean and nicely sized. The hotel is within walking distance of all the main places; The Hippodrome, the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar, Aya Sofya, Basilica Cistern, the Turkish Museum of Calligraphy and Islamic Arts, the Topkapi palace, the tram and various places to eat. The staff are very helpful and were very accommodating and responsive to any requests we had. Okan (gentleman who works there) loved our children and was always laughing and joking with them which made us and our kids feel very welcome. The customer service provided by Okan in particular was outstanding. We wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Daphne again, and will recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty and Kindness reside!”
Reviews.Author: LucknowSeattle
Reviews.Content: Our experience with the Daphne Hotel was amazing! All my life I had dreamed of going to Istanbul! Finally, we arrived, and were hit by a car on the second night...Then, it proceeded to snow, for three days! Although very beautiful, we were tired, having trudged through the city in the cold and snow. We switched to the Daphne, our last three nights in Istanbul, and what a wonderful decision. Ah,The nurturing beautiful Hotel Daphne!! The owners were extremely kind and thoughtful, and attended to our every need. We didn't have the heart to tell them about our misfortunes ealier, but instead, absored the soothing views of the Bosphorous Sea and a spotless, elegant room in the lovely Daphne! I can say that, inspite of the misfortunes of our first few days inn Is tanbul, all was erased by the positve treatment at the Daphne! I could never recommend a hotel more wholeheartedly!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Daphne was great!”
Reviews.Author: Culturist
Reviews.Content: We had two stays, at the beginning and end of our visit to Turkey, and thought the Hotel Daphne was outstanding value. The location is perfect for sightseeing in the Sultanahmet, and the rooms are charmingly furnished, with views of the Bosphorus over the Sokullu Mosque. In summer, the roof garden is a perfect place to enjoy a meal. The hotel is just above the Hippodrome and the Blue Mosque, and only a short walk to the Grand Bazaar, Hagia Sofia, Basilica Cistern, the Sokullu Mosque and others, great shopping, and excellent restaurants. The Daphne breakfast was the best we had in Turkey. The staff are helpful and you can leave your suitcases while you sightsee before an afternoon departure. We left cases for a week, without any problem. We will stay at the Daphne next time, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic..Would Recommend 100%”
Reviews.Author: Reenz18
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been absolutely FANTASTIC with us. We four friends were in a problem and were scared of our safety in the hotel we were staying in Kumkapi. Walking around, we came to this hotel, and from the moment we stepped in, all the staff had been absolutely helpful. The owner himself personally helped us and treated us well. We felt at ease and at home. He even arranged for a staff to come with us to get our luggage from the other hotel. Because we were so scared of our safety, we wanted to stay in one room, and the staff especially made the room more comfortable for us by providing camp bed. I cannot express how happy we were to find this hotel, and my only regret is that I wished we had come to this hotel first. But I definitely would come back to this hotel again, when required. This hotel was near to all the tourist locations such as the Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, etcâ€¦.. The room was absolutely beautiful and clean, with great air conditioning and lightning. The bathroom was exquisite. Most of all, the view was absolutely beautiful. The whole hotel was great, the terrace was fantastic with great views, and the breakfast was great. Most of all the staff and the owner were fantastic, and helped us to continue our holiday with happiness. I would definitely come again to this hotel. GREAT HOTEL WITH FANTASTIC VIEWS AND SERVICE!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view”
Reviews.Author: moose90
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights, and found the Daphne to be a very nice botique hotel. The staff were very helpful, rooms were very clean, and the position was excellent. The street is quiet and off the main beat, but it is only about a 8 minute walk to the blue mosque and many other interesting sites. I went there on business and did not want to stay in one of the big international chains and aia am very glad we did. We had room 401 which had a fantastic view of the ocean. I will stay there again when I return later this year. The old centre is the way to go as you are walking distance to the Bosphourous, spice market, bazaar, and many great areas with a wide selection of restaurants. If you would like to ask me any further questions, please e-mail on stanley.preston@purplepig.com.au

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel - Genuinely helpful”
Reviews.Author: Twoseasons
Reviews.Content: In January 06, in the middle of a snow storm, I stayed in the Daphne and left it with memories of a special visit. I returned in June this year, again passing through Istanbul on the way to a conference. I stayed in the Daphne both going and coming. This is an excellent hotel, excellent because of the high quality of its accommodation but especially excellent because of the friendly and helpful staff. During my stay nothing was too much trouble and when working or relaxing they provided a welcome supply of tea. The roof top bar is a joy! The Daphne is a few steps away from the Blue Mosque and the excellent tram system.

Reviews.Title: “A really super hotal, excellent service, great location”
Reviews.Author: adventuregirl23
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel Daphne for 3 nights and were very impressed by it. We had a corner room at the front of the hotel with two windows and a wonderful view of the Sea of Mamara and a lovely mosque. The room itself was very spacious and tastefully decorated and the en-suite bathroom was fabulous, with towels and toiletries replaced daily. It is very centrally located in the Sultanahmet district of the city and just a 5 minute walk away from the Blue Mosque and other major sites. Excellent breakfast too! Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we'd hoped”
Reviews.Author: Hermes111
Reviews.Content: After reading the rave reviews, maybe we were expecting too much. In its favour, the hotel was centrally located in Sultanahmet so great for the 'major' sites, and within easy reach of the trams. It was clean and the beds comfortable. On the downside, the restaurant food was pretty poor - we ate there on the first night, a lamb kebab was mainly offal. The breakfast buffet was passable but they frequently ran out of coffee, water, cups etc and as the person replenishing them also seemed to be running the reception area, it was good luck if there was ever any more. The legendary helpfulness of the staff was not in evidence: when we asked for directions the receptionist was indifferent and made no effort to try to direct us. If you just need a base in this area of Istanbul, I guess it's OK, but it certainly didn't enhance our enjoyment of the city.

Reviews.Title: “What A Little Beauty of A Hotel......”
Reviews.Author: boyinjun
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 glorious nights at this small hotel ( 20 rooms or so ) on the very much the quieter side of the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul....of, course, in which ever part of the Sultanahmet area you are, you can never ever get away from the Muezzins !!! Mr Cicek, the General Manager, an extremely affable & amiable man, was constantly pestered by me, prior to arrival for a good sea view room....which he duly obliged...on the top floor, with a panoramic view of the Marmara !!! Mr Cicek & his happy bunch of crew members ( especially the very happy singing & dancing receptionist...pity I do not recall his name !! ), would bend over backwards to oblige you in any quarter...whether in terms of matters in relation to the Hotel, general Touristic assistance or very importantly in the direction of NON COMMERCIALISED TOURIST FREQUENTED Restaurants !!! To my friends, family & I this was such a perfect start into the fortnight's holiday into Turkey !!!

Reviews.Title: “delightful”
Reviews.Author: JKMLondon
Reviews.Content: Its in a great location, must be about the best in sultanhmet as it overlooks a garden and is on a steep cobbled street. No restaurant when we were there but has an excellent place opposite. Room lovely, amazing marble bathroom, huge bed, total luxury, satellite and wi fi, all very good value. Roof terrace stunning views, staff everywhere and longing to help. Only negative is that doors seem thin and a light sleeper may find the hotel a little noisy

Reviews.Title: “very convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: KLMFreiburg
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a comfortable, small and quiet hotel in the old city of Istanbul, close to the main attractions. Hotel Daphne was recommanded in a well known German travel guide (Dumont richtig reisen, Istanbul) to correspond to these criteria. Hotel Daphne was a good choice. It's really quiet, although only ten minutes away from the famous Blue Mosque, has nice rooms, especially those with sea view, and helpful staff. As we came in early May and had rather fresh weather, the beautiful restaurant on the roof was not yet working. Thomas Keller Former UNESCO Director

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TheNotchMan
Reviews.Content: Seven days at the Hotel Daphne was perfect. Renovated just a few years ago, everything is new, clean, and very nice. All the hotel staff were very helpful. The location is great for walking just about anywhere in Istanbul. The morning buffet breakfast, which is provided, was a really nice way to start off the day. The rates were very good compared to other hotels - once I arrived in Istanbul and looked at some of the other hotels I considered before making the trip, I was glad I picked the Daphne. I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A Turkish Delight”
Reviews.Author: Kuga24
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Istanbul so know how awful the traffic can be. Even though I have lots of friends still living there I choose to stay in the Daphne Hotel because it is literally minutes away from the 'must see sights' and the Grand Bazaar (5,000 shops!!) The new tramway has transformed travel for everyone. Buy a Jeton for 1.30 YTL first at the booth beside the tram stop. You can catch it in Sultanahmet and get off at the end -Kabatash. Walk 5 mins along the Bosphorus and you come to Dolmabace Palace which is a lovely place to visit. Istanbul is a very safe place to visit. (Of course the usual rules for visiting any city apply though) The Turks are friendly and many speak excellent English although nearly all of them seem to have a relative with a carpet shop and if you go with them it's two hours of your life you will never have back again.... Just smile and keep walking! The hotel is not large and most of the rooms have a super view of the Sea of Marmara. You can see 50 ships at a glance waiting there for their turn to go along the Bosphorus to the Black Sea. The staff are very friendly and nothing is too much trouble. The rooms are now all renovated with a Turkish twist and the en suite bathrooms are very nice indeed. The beds are super comfortable!! The food is good and very reasonable and perfect when you have been sightseeing all day and just want to have a quiet night. I'm already planning my next stay later this year.

Reviews.Title: “good for families”
Reviews.Author: fman03
Reviews.Content: family friendly hotel, minutes away from the main sites. we are a family of 4 and took two ajoining rooms which worked out perfectly. if you have a young family then this hotel is recommended as the sites are a few minutes walk away (mostly down hill). the hippodrome (large open area) is a couple of minutes away which is great for letting the kids release some steam. importantly this hotel also has a lift, which is a life saver if you also have a buggy, laden with shopping. staff is friendly and accomdating

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful European Hotel”
Reviews.Author: visit2family
Reviews.Content: Close in, Great friendly service, Clean, within walking distance of important tourist's sites. Great Turkish breakfast one of the few places in Turkey to offer drip coffee. Suggested by family living in Turkey as a closely held locals secret. Now the secret is out. Family friendly as we were traveling with family of 5, all had great time. Take public transportation, it is great in Istambul. Helpful English speaking staff genuinely were interested in our positive Istambul experience.

Reviews.Title: “Daphne: good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Pooji
Reviews.Content: Nice small, but clean rooms, some with a view on the Bosporus. Friendly and helpful staff. Location: 5 min. to Blue Mosque. Taxis barely find it (but they barely find anything, anyhow). Breakfast is ok (they also serve more than on the buffet, at additional charge). Hotel is highly recommended, if you prefer value and location over style and size.

Reviews.Title: “It is a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mahekmehta
Reviews.Content: it is a very good hotel, situated in sultanahemt so there is an easy accessibilty to teh historic places and also to the markets. the hospitality is just great. I have stayed here for my two trips, business as well as a vacation trip. it was great fun.

Reviews.Title: “an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Joop_Zoetemelk
Reviews.Content: We had a perfect stay in Dapgne Hotel in Istanbul. All major hotspots are on a walking distance from the hotel. Our ( clean ) room had a splendid view on the Bosporus. Ideal hotel for a city trip !

Reviews.Title: “The Daphne Hotel was as much our holiday home as our hotel”
Reviews.Author: BoldBear
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from 13 wonderful days in Istanbul. A major contributor to this great holiday was our stay at the Hotel Daphne. We can strongly recommend this as your choice if you do not want a chain hotel or hostel environment. Look, with us, at the Daphneâ€™s features. * Its staff, from Management to Service, is warm and very helpful with personal and a touristâ€™s needs. * It is a small tastefully decorated hotel with large and comfortable rooms complete with cable tv. * It is conveniently located within easy walking distance to the overwhelming number of mosques, palaces, museums, markets, etc., in a quiet neighborhood of the historic Sultanamet district. * Breakfact (included) is sumptuous, healthy and varied to satisfy our tastes for both familiar and Turkish food. The Daphne is where we will return when we go back to Istanbul. Bernard and Janet B. Seattle, WA

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chinche
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a one night stay at the Daphne Hotel in Istanbul. What an experience!!! The hotel was in a great location. There is a terrace on the top to take in the spectacular view . The rooms have a view to the Bosphorus. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. The breakfast was a wonderful Turkish feast!!! The staff was always ready to help with a smile. There is nothing like Turkish hospitality. I reccommend this hotel highly. I will be returning myself in May!!! Thanks to my wonderful friend for having found this hotel!!!! Suzanne

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: kathlekrn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a total of eight nights while on vacation. It was wonderful. The hotel is minutes away from the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia and the Hippodrome, but is located on a quiet side street. This was problematic a few times because many taxi drivers do not know where the Daphne is - be sure to take the hotel card with the map when you are out sightseeing. The staff are wonderful, friendly people who did everything they could to make our trip memorable and pleasant. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. Ask for a sea view room before you arrive. And breakfast is great - bread, cheese, cereal, yogurt, juice, pastries, dried fruit, vegetables and olives, and of course, coffee and turkish tea.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TAMemberIndia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Daphne Hotel in November 2007. Our room (#301) was very comfortable with a fabulous view. The hotel itself is charming and the lobby very inviting. In particular, I was very impressed with the service - friendly, helpful and courteous. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Daphne!”
Reviews.Author: VTtravelerVT
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Daphne twice while passing through Istanbul. Enjoyed it both times. Location in Sultanahmet is very convenient, not only to Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia and Topkapi but easy access to the tram and to ferry service. The staff was helpful and friendly. The Hotel Daphne is a very good deal. I can highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: McGregors89
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay here very much. The hotel had a friendly family atmosphere and the manager, Mr Gigek, was a gentleman. George McGregor

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Daphne !”
Reviews.Author: istanbul0907
Reviews.Content: We were concerned after reading a recent review "Disappointing stay..." However, all our concerns were allayed when we arrived at the Dahpne. The staff were wonderful, location is great and most importantly the rooms are very clean. For us the location and cleanliness of the room were very important and Daphne came out on tops on both counts. The room was nicely decorated, the bathroom was very clean (which was v. important for me !) and we had a great view of the Marmara from our room. The hotel is located barely 2-3 minutes from the Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Divanyolu and Arasta Bazaar. Topkapi and Ayasofya are barely 5 minutes away. You can catch the tram from Divanyolu as well, which makes everything within easy reach. The staff were wonderful and helped us plan out visits and also arranged for the shuttle back to the airport. They also provide free transport from the airport to the hotel and 10% discount if you pay by cash. All in all, it was a great visit - we loved Istanbul and Daphne and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic Place!”
Reviews.Author: benedinburgh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for a relaxed and friendly stay in Istanbul. My girlfriend and I planned to stay at the hotel for just our first night and then find something cheaper. However after the exceptional friendly service, clean and comfortable bedrooms and breakfasts overlooking the Bhosphorus we couldnt resist staying for another three nights. Definately worth paying a little more for this hotel, makes a stay in the hectic bustling metropolis a piece of cake. Also great location, close to all of the main sights. Thankyou to all the staff that were so helpful and friendly throughout our stay (especially the manager who lent us an umberella that I managed to leave in a taxi - sorry!) Ben

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: alisonjtait
Reviews.Content: I was full of excitement when i booked this hotel. It looked like it would be fabulous. I was wrong. the bathroom was not clean when we arrived and was never fully cleaned while we were there. the breakfast lacked anything interesting - including cold eggs if you came down after 9. Not to mention on the last morning we took a look at the basket of oranges and many were very moldy. The service was good and the rooms were nice, although the fixtures were cheap and starting to come apart. The rooftop was also a disappointment. It seemed deserted when we got up there - there was nothing behind the bar accept for lights so bright you couldn't see the view. All is all, over priced for what it was - go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value/Friendly Hotel in good Sultanhamet Location”
Reviews.Author: John-Vi
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, nicely appointed, quiet hotel in a convenient walk to everything location. Hotel staff were very nice and helpful, especially the front desk man, Ali. He made good recommendations for tours and entertainment. Good location, on quite street, a few blocks from many excellent restaurants, the Blue Mosque, Ayia Sofia & the streetcar to most other sites.

HotelInfo.Name: Daphne Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Binbirdirek Mh. Su Terazisi Sok. No : 10, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
